intro: Gilia eremica var. zionis, commonly known as Zion's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Zion's gilia is often found in areas with well-drained soils, such as cliffs and slopes.
